BICM.cpp

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 
00011 //#define TO_FILE
00012 
00013 #include "itpp/itcomm.h"//for BPSK and BERC classes
00014 #include "SISO.h"//SISO class
00015 #include "Progress_Timer.h"
00016 
00017 using namespace itpp;
00018 using tr::SISO;
00019 using tr::threshold;
00020 using std::cout;
00021 using std::endl;
00022 using std::string;
00023 
00024 int main(void)
00025 {
00026     //general parameters
00027     int const_size = 16;//constellation size
00028     double threshold_value = 50;
00029     string map_metric="maxlogMAP";
00030     ivec gen = "037 021";
00031     int constraint_length = 5;
00032     int nb_errors_lim = 1500;
00033     int nb_bits_lim = int(1e6);
00034     int perm_len = pow2i(14);//permutation length
00035     int nb_iter = 10;//number of iterations in the turbo decoder
00036     vec EbN0_dB = "20";
00037     double R = 1.0/2.0;//coding rate of FEC
00038     double Es = 1.0;//mean symbol energy    
00039 
00040     //QAM modulator class
00041     QAM mod(const_size);
00042 
00043     //other parameters
00044     string filename = "Res/BICM_"+map_metric+".it";
00045     int nb_symb = perm_len/mod.bits_per_symbol();
00046     int nb_bits_tail = perm_len/gen.length();
00047     int nb_bits = nb_bits_tail-(constraint_length-1);//number of bits in a block (without tail)
00048     vec sigma2 = (0.5*Es/(R*mod.bits_per_symbol()))*pow(inv_dB(EbN0_dB), -1.0);//N0/2
00049     int nb_blocks;//number of blocks
00050     int nb_errors;
00051     bvec bits(nb_bits);//data bits
00052     bvec coded_bits(perm_len);//tail is added
00053     cvec em(perm_len);
00054     ivec perm(perm_len);
00055     ivec inv_perm(perm_len);
00056     cvec rec(perm_len);    
00057     //SISO demodulator
00058     vec demod_apriori_data(perm_len);
00059     vec demod_extrinsic_data;
00060     //SISO NSC
00061     vec nsc_intrinsic_coded(perm_len);
00062     vec nsc_apriori_data(nb_bits_tail);
00063     nsc_apriori_data.zeros();//always zero
00064     vec nsc_extrinsic_coded;
00065     vec nsc_extrinsic_data;
00066     //decision
00067     bvec rec_bits(nb_bits_tail);    
00068     int snr_len = EbN0_dB.length();
00069     mat ber(nb_iter,snr_len);
00070     ber.zeros();
00071     register int en,n;
00072     
00073     //CC
00074     Convolutional_Code nsc;
00075     nsc.set_generator_polynomials(gen, constraint_length);
00076     
00077     //Rayleigh fading
00078     cvec ch_attenuations(nb_symb);    
00079     //AWGN
00080     AWGN_Channel awgn;
00081 
00082     //SISO blocks
00083     SISO siso;
00084     siso.set_constellation(mod.bits_per_symbol(), mod.get_symbols(), mod.get_bits2symbols());
00085     siso.set_generators(gen, constraint_length);
00086     siso.set_map_metric(map_metric);   
00087     
00088     //detector
00089     BPSK bpsk;
00090     
00091     //BER
00092     BERC berc;
00093 
00094     //progress timer
00095     tr::Progress_Timer timer;
00096     timer.set_max(snr_len);
00097         
00098     //Randomize generators
00099     RNG_randomize();
00100     
00101     //main loop
00102     timer.progress(0.0);
00103     for (en=0;en<snr_len;en++)
00104     {
00105         awgn.set_noise(2*sigma2(en));
00106         siso.set_noise(sigma2(en));
00107         nb_errors = 0;
00108         nb_blocks = 0;
00109         while ((nb_errors<nb_errors_lim) && (nb_blocks*nb_bits<nb_bits_lim))//if at the last iteration the nb. of errors is inferior to lim, then process another block
00110         {
00111             //permutation
00112             perm = sort_index(randu(perm_len));
00113             //inverse permutation
00114             inv_perm = sort_index(perm);
00115 
00116             //bits generation
00117             bits = randb(nb_bits);
00118 
00119             //convolutional code
00120             nsc.encode_tail(bits, coded_bits);//tail is added here to information bits to close the trellis         
00121 
00122             //permutation+QAM modulation
00123             em = mod.modulate_bits(coded_bits(perm));                       
00124             
00125             //flat-fading channel
00126             ch_attenuations = randn_c(nb_symb);
00127             rec = awgn(elem_mult(ch_attenuations, em));
00128 
00129             //turbo receiver
00130             demod_apriori_data.zeros();//a priori information of emitted bits
00131             siso.set_impulse_response(ch_attenuations);
00132             for (n=0;n<nb_iter;n++)
00133             {
00134                 //first decoder
00135                 siso.demapper(demod_extrinsic_data, rec, demod_apriori_data);
00136                
00137                 //deinterleave+threshold
00138                 nsc_intrinsic_coded = threshold(demod_extrinsic_data(inv_perm), threshold_value);
00139 
00140                 //second decoder
00141                 siso.nsc(nsc_extrinsic_coded, nsc_extrinsic_data, nsc_intrinsic_coded, nsc_apriori_data, true);                
00142 
00143                 //decision
00144                 rec_bits = bpsk.demodulate_bits(-nsc_extrinsic_data);//suppose that a priori info is zero
00145                 //count errors
00146                 berc.clear();
00147                 berc.count(bits, rec_bits.left(nb_bits));
00148                 ber(n,en) += berc.get_errorrate();
00149 
00150                 //interleave
00151                 demod_apriori_data = nsc_extrinsic_coded(perm);
00152             }//end iterations
00153             nb_errors += int(berc.get_errors());//get number of errors at the last iteration
00154             nb_blocks++;
00155         }//end blocks (while loop)
00156 
00157         //compute BER over all tx blocks
00158         ber.set_col(en, ber.get_col(en)/nb_blocks);
00159 
00160         //show progress
00161         timer.progress(1+en);
00162     }
00163     timer.toc_print();
00164     
00165 #ifdef TO_FILE
00166     //save results to file
00167     it_file ff(filename);
00168     ff << Name("BER") << ber;
00169     ff << Name("EbN0_dB") << EbN0_dB;
00170     ff << Name("gen") << gen;
00171     ff << Name("R") << R;
00172     ff << Name("nb_iter") << nb_iter;
00173     ff << Name("total_nb_bits") << nb_bits;
00174     ff << Name("nb_errors_lim") << nb_errors_lim;
00175     ff << Name("nb_bits_lim") << nb_bits_lim;
00176     ff.close();
00177 #else
00178     //show BER
00179     cout << ber << endl;
00180 #endif
00181 
00182     return 0;
00183 }
